generif.text: EFEMP1 has a role in retinal drusen formation and is involved in the etiology of macular degeneration and Malattia Leventinese.

The Arg345Trp disease-associated allele of the EFEMP1 gene does not appear to be associated with cases of early onset drusen, nor does it appear to play a role in familial age-related macular degeneration.
The 5' end of the FBLN3 gene has been characterized, and the important upstream motifs regulating its transcription have been identified.

The R345W mutation in EFEMP1 is pathogenic and causes AMD-like deposits in mice.

show that EFEMP1 binds EGF receptor (EGFR) in a competitive manner relative to epidermal growth factor (EGF), implicating that EFEMP1 and EGF share the same or adjacent binding sites on the EGFR.

Fibulin-3 is upregulated in gliomas and cultured glioma cells; the protein was undetectable in normal brain or astrocytes. Fibulin-3 did not seem to affect glioma cell morphology or proliferation, but enhanced cell adhesion and promoted motility.

No correlation between fibulin-3 and MRP8/14 was observed in the study group before and after the treatment. We found a poor correlation between serum fibulin-3 and other cartilage metabolism biomarkers after anti-TNF therapy.

Immunohistochemistry demonstrated that EFEMP1 is expressed in cholangiocytes and vascular smooth muscle cells in liver specimens from patients with BA and other cholestatic diseases, but it is absent from cholangiocytes in normal control liver samples.
We presented a family with Doyne honeycomb retinal disease. Gene sequencing results revealed heterozygous mutations in EFEMP1 gene, which were consistent with the DHRD/ ML.

Expression of fibulin-3 was downregulated in cutaneous squamous cell carcinoma (cSCC) tissues compared with normal skin tissues, which was due to fibulin-3 promoter methylation. Knockdown of fibulin-3 in cSCC cell lines A431 and SCL-1 cells promoted cell proliferation, protected cells against apoptosis and enhanced migration and invasion abilities. Results suggest that fibulin-3 has anti-tumorigenic activities in cSCC.
our research revealed the regulation of EFEMP1 on cell proliferation and apoptosis in HCC. EFEMP1 may suppress the growth of HCC cells by promoting SEMA3B.

BP.term: epidermal growth factor receptor signaling pathway

interpro.desc: Growth factor receptor cysteine-rich domain superfamily

name: EGF containing fibulin extracellular matrix protein 1
other_names: EGF containing fibulin like extracellular matrix protein 1
summary: This gene encodes a member of the fibulin family of extracellular matrix glycoproteins. Like all members of this family, the encoded protein contains tandemly repeated epidermal growth factor-like repeats followed by a C-terminus fibulin-type domain. This gene is upregulated in malignant gliomas and may play a role in the aggressive nature of these tumors. Mutations in this gene are associated with Doyne honeycomb retinal dystrophy. Alternatively spliced transcript variants that encode the same protein have been described.[provided by RefSeq, Nov 2009].
